pages.body:
# List of Zites: Services | [[zite-list-services-talk|Talk]]

### Sites that provide some sort of utility to the visitor can be classified as a 'Service' site

**[CodeR](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1CodEr7T9xNXSPcwbsvf5fHTqsixDMwDzL/).**  
CodeR is a JSFiddle (CodePen) for [[ZeroNet]]. It offers public codes, syntax highlighting, big list of libraries and transpilers: Babel, CoffeeScript, LiveScript, SASS, LESS.
  * Zite Address:   1CodEr7T9xNXSPcwbsvf5fHTqsixDMwDzL

**[Nullpaste](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz/).**  
Nullpaste is a version of Pastebin for [[ZeroNet]]. The zite offers both public and private publishing, syntax highlighting, and the ability to view recent pastes.  
  * Zite Address:   1MgHVPCE1ve6QfKrgsqCURzRj72HrRWioz  
  * Zite Discussion: [0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:1_16Szsy1UtjiXpEevWVdUDrNfNTAZ9PLbcY/NullPaste+Decentralized+pastebin+with+code+highlighting+encryption), ZeroCentral  
  * Zite Domain: 0pastebin.bit (unconfirmed)  

**[Authentication : ZeroID](http://127.0.0.1:43110/zeroid.bit/).**  
ZeroID is used as an authentication service for username ID's Obtaining a alias from this service will allow visitors to post comments on the various zites available on Zeronet.
  * Zite Address:   1iD5ZQJMNXu43w1qLB8sfdHVKppVMduGz  
  * Zite Discussion: 0List, ZeroCentral  
  * Zite Domain: zeroid.bit  

**[ZeroMail](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit/).**  
ZeroMail is ZeroNet's version of a mail client. ZeroMail allows visitors with a registered ZeroID username to send encrypted messages to other users who have a ZeroID username. The ZeroMail system can not be used to send email to external email addresses.  
  * Zite Address:  	1MaiL5gfBM1cyb4a8e3iiL8L5gXmoAJu27  
  * Zite Discussion: 0List, ZeroCentral, [ZeroTalk](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:10_1MxdAjWgnqwCaunGHmhY39tVR51qV3peJL/ZeroMail+support+thread)  
  * Zite Domain: Mail.ZeroNetwork.bit  

**[ZeroPolls](http://127.0.0.1:43110/ZeroPolls.bit/).**  
ZeroPolls is a polling platform that allows visitors with an assigned ZeroID to post and vote on polls. Results can be viewed after a vote is submitted and comments can be posted by clicking on the poll's title. **Be advised that there is a small chance that an attacker could discover your votes associated with your ZeroID with a bit of effort.**  
  * Zite Address:   1K28kQFMquNzto2iQf4GGjr6oFUbC1NddE  
  * Zite Discussion: 
[0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:1_1Mk5sVKeCrwMc3wSD11jM7DZTiqF5D9BaD/ZeroPolls), 
[ZeroCentral](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Dt7FR5aNLkqAjmosWh8cMWzJu633GYN6u/?Topic:4_1PvAyLAB5H1JKbiFjx95ZJXrNJVyWxs5Hf/ZeroPolls), ZeroTalk  
  * Zite Domain: ZeroPolls.bit  

**[ZeroProxies](http://127.0.0.1:43110/14y3fN1A214HYdKe5f6WnQdfT3PdKLSAJo/).**  
ZeroProxies is a site that contains a list of Zeronet proxy sites. These proxy sites allows visitors of the regular internet to be able to view a ZeroNet zite without installing or running the Zeronet client engine. Due to the portal being provided by a proxy, functionality can be limited.  
  * Zite Address:   14y3fN1A214HYdKe5f6WnQdfT3PdKLSAJo  
  * Zite Discussion: 
0List, 
ZeroCentral, 
[ZeroTalk](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1ArMJqDaBJqeJ4MX3VqSnkfwkHe23PtLrW/Running+a+ZeroProxy)  
  * Zite Domain: 0proxy.bit, 0proxies.bit, zeroproxy.bit, zeroproxies.bit  

**[ZeroQuotes](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1NJyPoPpL8At17T6G7A1qHVQdqZDBmXcLT).**  
ZeroQuotes is a platform that features Quotes submitted by visitors. The site allows visitors to vote on the quotes that they enjoy.  
  * Zite Address:   1NJyPoPpL8At17T6G7A1qHVQdqZDBmXcLT  
  * Zite Discussion: 
[0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:81_1M5ztUWkCMP5Pv7MjwApWT7CNvWimGFaFa/ZeroQuotes), 
[ZeroCentral](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Dt7FR5aNLkqAjmosWh8cMWzJu633GYN6u/?Topic:81_1M5ztUWkCMP5Pv7MjwApWT7CNvWimGFaFa/ZeroQuotes), ZeroTalk  
  * Zite Domain: n/a  

**[ZeroTODOs](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1B8LmXYHzMGZzcRWoidAQb5SmKSyfjN63f).**  
ZeroTODO's is a platform that allows visitors to create tasks and checklists and organize activity in a planner style.  
  * Zite Address:   1B8LmXYHzMGZzcRWoidAQb5SmKSyfjN63f  
  * Zite Discussion: 
[0List](http://127.0.0.1:43110/0list.bit/?Topic:100_1M5ztUWkCMP5Pv7MjwApWT7CNvWimGFaFa/ZeroTodos), 
ZeroCentral, ZeroTalk  
  * Zite Domain: n/a  

**[Authentication : ZeroVerse](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1HPgDoReCFtE9qy71hnp55ksBVvV1gHJLQ).**  
ZeroVerse is an alternative platform to ZeroID, While operating in a similar way, the service will eventually be accepted in multiple places that accept ZeroID usernames.  
  * Zite Address:   1HPgDoReCFtE9qy71hnp55ksBVvV1gHJLQ  
  * Zite Discussion: 
0List, ZeroCentral, 
[ZeroTalk](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:4_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf/yourID+ZeroVerse+bit+make+yourself+another+ZeroID)  
  * Zite Domain: zeroverse.bit  

**[QR Generator](http://127.0.0.1:43110/qrgen.bit/).**  
QR Generator creates QR codes instantly.   
  * Zite Address:   1NQhJp2DNAXwLUE6eFLVx7jnmBMEy3NJbo 
  * Zite Discussion: 
  * Zite Domain: qrgen.bit

**[IPFS crypto-addresses sharing](http://127.0.0.1:43110/17P4SJ1AsARbrj6naYbmAa7eSYCyr4UyJv/)**
  * Random
  * eLearning
  * Documentaries
  * Tutorials
  * Static HTML, eBooks
  * Applications ( GNU - Linux , Windows , MacOS , etc )
  * Movies, Series
  * Music
  * Sorted by years

**[zeroMaps](/1yUji4qPD7GAog8XkP3EDMEfrL995S4Xd/)**
   - Map of the Earth planet

**[git over ZeroNet](/1xxooZ7s8iDz3u56i5mNQ1XGmwF8Zvnw9/)**

# ZeroMe Hubs
To use [[zerome|ZeroMe]] you need to choose a Hub. Many hubs offer very limited user space which may cause issues for you when you hit the limit.

The list of hubs below includes the user size limit.

Hubs with sufficient user space:
- [无限额度hub](/1ABFCaadiEa3bFNzN3RcCZSsviqMNTbz3m) 10YB (yottabyte) size limit
- [NSA (No Strings Attached) Hub](/1DSr6bv2DNVBCrFAMVCdCETWiWzeVTrjNY) 1GB size limit

Hubs with limited user space:

- [WhiteHub](/1White24UrrwQrD86o6Vrc1apgZ1x1o51) 60kB size limit

[[SQL]]
----
What is [[SQL]]?
---
[[SQL]] (Structured Query Language) is a domain-specific language used in programming and designed for managing data held in a relational database management system ([[RDBMS]]), or for stream processing in a relational data stream management system ([[RDSMS]]).

What kind of programming language is [[SQL]]?
---
[[SQL]] (Structured Query Language) is a computer language aimed to store, manipulate, and query data stored in relational databases. The first incarnation of [[SQL]] appeared in 1974, when a group in [[IBM]] developed the first prototype of a relational [[database]].

What is a [[syntax]] in [[SQL]]?
---
[[SQL]] is followed by unique set of rules and guidelines called [[Syntax]]. All the [[SQL]] statements start with any of the keywords like SELECT, INSERT, UPDATE, DELETE, ALTER, DROP, CREATE, USE, SHOW and all the statements end with a semicolon (;).

What are the commands used in [[SQL]]?
---
Some of the most important [[SQL]] commands include the following:

- SELECT - extracts data from a database
- UPDATE - updates data in a database
- DELETE - deletes data from a database
- INSERT INTO - inserts new data into a database
- CREATE DATABASE - creates a new database
- ALTER DATABASE - modifies a database
- CREATE TABLE - creates a new table
- ALTER TABLE - modifies a table
- DROP TABLE - deletes a table
- CREATE INDEX - creates an index (search key)
- DROP INDEX - deletes an index

What is the meaning of [[SQL]] (Structured Query Language)?
---
[[SQL]] (Structured Query Language) is a standard computer language for relational [[database]] management and data manipulation. [[SQL]] is used to query, insert, update and modify data.

# Zite

A Zite is a [[ZeroNet]] [[website]]. Zites have the notable difference of being entirely [[decentralized]] and work even if the visitor is offline. Zites are designed to be entirely [[open source]] and freely shared. Zite owners can also make their site [[cloneable]]. This ensures content is not censored and cannot be forcefully taken down.

However, due to how the site is distributed and viewed, sites must be entirely contained within local [[HTML]] and [[JavaScript]] files. Information for the site can be stored in an [[SQLite]] database or in [[JSON]] files.

Zites require the private key generated with the address in order to be edited or published. Users of the zite have a subdirectory they may edit within the zite's file structure.

[ZeroTuto](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Jtjb5CU9aod4jtz8hF5NPPqFKofRSsb4x/), is a great resource for creating zites.

Various attempts have been made to index and search the hundreds of zites that have been created. [[Search engine|Search engines]] like [[Kaffiene]] or [[ZeroSearch]] allow searching through hand-crafted indexes using key terms. While other zites, like [[0list]] or [[ZeroCentral]], allow user submissions to generate a list.

# Proxies

A proxy is a website that you can reach using any web-capable device that runs a multi-user [[ZeroNet]] instance. *[Learn how to host one](/kindlyfire.bit/?Post:9:Running+a+ZeroProxy)*. You can also install [[AWS Shadow Socks]].

There also is a website dedicated to listing proxies: [zeroproxies.bit](/zeroproxies.bit), but it is outdated.

- https://bit.surf:43110/ (replacing https://bit.no.com:43110/)
- https://zn.maly.io/
- https://0netproxy.ml/

- http://cvhb5yx2qdclb76m.onion/ (Onion, only usable over [[Tor]])

# Installing AWS ShadowSocks

1. Open https://aws.amazon.com/. To complete registration, you need a credit card

2. Login, select the nearest physical location.
![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-075204.jpg)

3. Select service "EC2"
![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-074617.jpg)

4. Install the virtual machine

    * Start the instance
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-075400.jpg)

    * Select "Ubuntu Server"
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-075620.jpg)

    * For example, select "t2 micro", then click "review and launch in Tokyo" (the price is about 11.52$)
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-080145.jpg)

    * Click "Start" to create the virtual machine
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-082501.jpg)

4. Choose virtual machine settings

    * Download .pem for connecting
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-083016.jpg)
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-083330.jpg)

5. Choose "launch-wizard-2", then add open port and inbound rules
![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-083828.jpg)
![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-083948.jpg)

5. Use SSH to connect to the virtual machine and install the SS service

    * Open terminal, `cd downloads`
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-084805.jpg)
    `chmod 400 ***.pem` - use .pem file from Step 4 create the password file, change path and IP to your own:
    * `ssh -i ***.pem ubuntu@54.65.197.180`
    * The connection is successful
    ![](http://fullstack-public.oss-cn-qingdao.aliyuncs.com/2017-05-19-085019.jpg)

    * Establish root password: `sudo passwd`

    * Install SS service
    ```bash
    $ su
    Password:
    $ sudo apt-get update
    $ sudo apt-get install-y python-pip
    $ export LC_ALL=C
    $ sudo pip install shadowsocks
    $ sudo pip install --upgrade pip
    $ sudo apt-get install-y python-m2crypto
    $ cat >>/etc/shadowsocks.json<<EOF
    ```json
    {
    "server":"0.0.0.0",
    "server_port":443,
    "local_address": "127.0.0.1",
    "local_port":1080,
    "password":"woaibeijintiananmen",
    "timeout":300,
    "method":"aes-256-cfb"
    }
    EOF
    ```
    ```bash
    $ sudo chmod 755 /etc/shadowsocks.json
    $ cat >>/etc/rc. local<<EOF
    /usr/local/bin/ssserver –c /etc/shadowsocks. json
    EOF
    $ sudo ssserver-c /etc/shadowsocks. json-d start
    ```
